sonicscrewdriverr: There is something problematic here(imo). Glorification of strength is NOT a patriarchal hangup. Because strength isn't only a male characteristic. The face that basic human emotions are being divided into masculine and feminine is in itself, problematic.
kartike.ya: Lmao. This is so stupid. Strength has nothing to do with patriarchy. Being strong doesn't mean that you'll lose your sensitivity. You want to be vulnerable and not strong? Good luck facing the challenges life offers everyone. Lol. Pure feminazi bullshit.
bohoheartt: Love this. I am done being strong.
agrawal_rupal: Because don't cry, don't be vulnerable, try to be strong are expressions of psuedo masculinity and we defy it.
gowriii89: Celebrities like @sonamkapoor sometimes don't relaise how much of an effect they have on their fans by sharing such things. Absolutely no accountability for them. #didnotexpectthisfromsonamkapoor
shivangied: But strength is a near necessity, whether in men or women, whether patriarchally constructed or not, whether overrated or not. Never saying vulnerability should be looked down upon. shru712: Like! But I guess in a way being vulnerable is a kind of strength? Because not many people can expose their soft side, their vulnerability.
